name: undistributed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not given out to people, or shared between a number of people: How many doses of flu vaccine were undistributed last year? Enough extra medals were made to cover any potential ties, and all undistributed medals were destroyed.
More examplesFewer examplesFor a week now the volunteers have been sleeping among the undistributed relief supplies on the coach.Planeloads of food remain undistributed and a small army of lorries struggles to cover the still flooded terrain. After checking court records, he discovered more than £130,000 in the bank, undistributed by the court system and unclaimed by the victims.

Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe the part of a company's profits that it has kept rather than paid to shareholders: undistributed earnings/profit The Chancellor is considering changes to the tax treatment of undistributed earnings.
